page.title: 08THE ATHENA B
page.content: In January 1980,a large cargo ship ran aground on the beach a little east of the Palace Pier at high tide in a severe storm. Thousands of sightseers came to Brighton to see the stranded vessel,and soon,the storekeepers reopened their shops closed for the winter and began selling souvenirs and refreshments and made quite a profit from the visitors. On February 14th,an unusually high tide was expected.and an attempt was made to refloat the vessel.Sightseers came to witness the event and the main roads to Brighton were jammed with traffic.It was estimated that the crowd reached 3OOOO.Against the bookies odds of 6 to 4 the vessel was refloated.
